Question
========
Below you find the output of a factor analyses on 8 items measuring extraversion.

```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(knitr)
Factor <- 1:8
Eigenvalue <- c(2.2, 1.8, 1.1, 0.9, 0.8, "...", 0.3, 0.3)
table <- cbind(Factor, Eigenvalue)
kable(table, caption = 'Table 1')
```

Calculate the eigenvalue of the 6th Factor.


Solution
========
The eigenvalue of the 6th factor can be calculated as follows. The sum of the eigenvalues of 8 variables equals 8. The sum of the eigenvalues of the factors present in the table is: $2.2+1.8+1.1+.9+.8+.3+.3=7.4$. Thus, the eigenvalue of the 6th factor is: $8â€7.4= .6$.
